concept_data.title: West African Monetary Union
concept_data.preferred_term: West African Economic and Monetary Union

summary: The "West African Monetary Union," now redirected to the "West African Economic and Monetary Union," represents a significant framework for economic cooperation among member countries. Established to facilitate monetary integration, it succeeded earlier agreements and is governed by mechanisms that authorise the functioning of a common currency. The Union's directives and provisions, negotiated in conjunction with bilateral agreements, aim to enhance economic stability and promote services across the region. The conclusion of these negotiations, signed in June and approved by the respective parliaments, reflects the commitment to replace existing frameworks with more effective instruments. This agreement, effective from a specified date, underscores the importance of open dialogue and consent among member states in achieving their economic objectives.
